connect_timeout.description: Maximum wait for connection, in seconds. Zero or not specified means wait indefinitely.

password.description: Password to authenticate with Infoblox server.

pool_connections.description: Maximum number of connections to establish to the Infoblox server. Zero means unlimited.

port.description: Port number used for connection for Infoblox Server.

sslmode.description: If set, Infoblox client will permit unverifiable SSL certificates.

username.description: User to authenticate with Infoblox server.

wapi_version.description: WAPI Version of Infoblox server defaults to v2.12.3

cidr.description: Network to allocate an IP address from, when the 'ip_addr' field is empty (dynamic allocation). The address is in CIDR format. For static allocation, leave this field empty.

dns_view.description: DNS view which the zone does exist within.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the A-record to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format

filter_params.description: The parent network block's extensible attributes (dynamic allocation). For static allocation, leave this field empty.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

ip_addr.description: IP address to associate with the A-record. For static allocation, set the field with a valid IP address. For dynamic allocation, leave this field empty and set 'cidr' and 'network_view' fieldsor 'filter_params' and optional 'network_view' fields.

network_view.description: Network view to use when allocating an IP address from a network dynamically. For static allocation, leave this field empty.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

ipv6_addr.description: IP address to associate with the AAAA-record. For static allocation, set the field with a valid IP address. For dynamic allocation, leave this field empty and set 'cidr' and 'network_view' fieldsor 'filter_params' and optional 'network_view' fields.

network_view.description: Network view to use when allocating an IP address from a network dynamically. For static allocation, leave this field empty.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

disable.description: A boolean flag which indicates if the alias record is disabled.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

alias.description: The alias name in FQDN format.

canonical.description: The Canonical name in FQDN format.

name.description: The name of the DNS View to be specified

network_view.description: The name of the Network View in which DNS View exists.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

auto_consolidated_monitors.description: Flag for enabling auto managing DTC Consolidated Monitors on related DTC Pools.

comment.description: Description of the DTC LBDN record.

disable.description: Determines whether the DTC LBDN is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the fixed address is enabled.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the DTC LBDN record to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

lb_method.description: The load balancing method. Used to select pool. Valid values are GLOBAL_AVAILABILITY, RATIO, ROUND_ROBIN, SOURCE_IP_HASH and TOPOLOGY.

name.description: The display name of the DTC LBDN.

persistence.description: Maximum time, in seconds, for which client specific LBDN responses will be cached. Zero specifies no caching.

priority.description: The LBDN pattern match priority for “overlapping” DTC LBDN objects. LBDNs are “overlapping” if they are simultaneously assigned to a zone and have patterns that can match the same FQDN. The matching LBDN with highest priority (lowest ordinal) will be used.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

topology.description: The topology rules for TOPOLOGY method.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the DTC LBDN. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

types.description: The list of resource record types supported by LBDN. Valid values are A, AAAA, CNAME, NAPTR, SRV. Default value is A and AAAA

dns_view.description: The DNS view in which the zone is available.

fqdn.description: Fully qualified domain name of an Authoritative zone.

block.description: List of linked auth zones with their respective views.
Pools associated with the LBDN are collections of load-balanced servers

auto_consolidated_monitors.description: Flag for enabling auto managing DTC Consolidated Monitors in DTC Pool.

availability.description: A resource in the pool is available if ANY, at least QUORUM, or ALL monitors for the pool say that it is up.

disable.description: Determines if the zone is disabled or not.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the  Dtc Pool to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

lb_alternate_method.description: The alternate load balancing method. Use this to select a method type from the pool if the preferred method does not return any results.

lb_alternate_topology.description: The alternate topology for load balancing.

lb_dynamic_ratio_alternate.description: The DTC Pool settings for dynamic ratio when it’s selected as alternate method.

lb_dynamic_ratio_preferred.description: The DTC Pool settings for dynamic ratio when it’s selected as preferred method.

lb_preferred_method.description: Load Balancing Preferred Method of the DTC pool.

lb_preferred_topology.description: The preferred topology for load balancing.

name.description: Name of the DTC pool.

quorum.description: For availability mode QUORUM, at least this many monitors must report the resource as up for it to be available

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

ttl.description: TTL value for the Dtc Pool.

availability.description: Servers assigned to a pool with monitor defined are healthy if ANY or ALL members report healthy status.

full_health_communication.description: Flag for switching health performing and sharing behavior to perform health checks on each DTC grid member that serves related LBDN(s) and send them across all DTC grid members from both selected and non-selected lists.

members.description: Members whose monitor statuses are shared across other members in a pool

block.description: List of monitors and associated members statuses of which are shared across members and consolidated in server availability determination.
Monitors associated with the DTC pool.

server.description: The name of the server for the pool

auto_create_host_record.description: Enabling this option will auto-create a single read-only A/AAAA/CNAME record corresponding to the configured hostname and update it if the hostname changes.

disable.description: Determines if the zone is disabled or not.

host.description: The address or FQDN of the server.

sni_hostname.description: The hostname for Server Name Indication (SNI) in FQDN format.

host.description: IP address or FQDN of the server used for monitoring.

monitor_name.description: The monitor name related to server.

monitor_type.description: The monitor type related to server.

block.description: List of IP/FQDN and monitor pairs to be used for additional monitoring.

aliases.description: A set of IP allocation aliases

allocated_ipv4_addr.description: Value which comes from 'ipv4_addr' (if specified) or from auto-allocation function (using 'ipv4_cidr' or 'filter_params').

allocated_ipv6_addr.description: Value which comes from 'ipv6_addr' (if specified) or from auto-allocation function (using 'ipv6_cidr' or 'filter_params').

comment.description: A description of IP address allocation.

disable.description: Disables the Host record if set to 'true'.

dns_view.description: DNS view under which the zone has been created.

enable_dns.description: flag that defines if the host record is to be used for DNS purposes.

ext_attrs.description: The extensible attributes for IP address allocation, as a map in JSON format

filter_params.description: The parent network block's extensible attributes. This field is used for dynamic allocation along with 'ip_address_type' field.

fqdn.description: The host name for Host Record in FQDN format.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

ip_address_type.description: The type of IP address to allocate. This filed is used only when 'filter_params' field is used. Valid values are: IPV4, IPV6, Both. Default value is IPV4

ipv4_addr.description: IPv4 address of cloud instance.Set a valid IP address for static allocation and leave empty if dynamically allocated.

ipv4_cidr.description: The IPv4 cidr from which an IPv4 address will be allocated.

ipv6_addr.description: IPv6 address of cloud instance.Set a valid IP address for static allocation and leave empty if dynamically allocated.

ipv6_cidr.description: The IPv6 cidr from which an IPv6 address will be allocated.

network_view.description: network view name on NIOS server.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

ttl.description: TTL attribute value for the record.

enable_dhcp.description: The flag which defines if the host record is to be used for IPAM purposes.

internal_id.description: This value must point to the ID of the appropriate allocation resource. Required on resource creation.

mac_addr.description: MAC address of a cloud instance.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

agent_circuit_id.description: The agent circuit ID for the fixed address.

agent_remote_id.description: The agent remote ID for the fixed address.

client_identifier_prepend_zero.description: This field controls whether there is a prepend for the dhcp-client-identifier of a fixed address.

comment.description: Comment for the fixed address; maximum 256 characters.

dhcp_client_identifier.description: The DHCP client ID for the fixed address. The field is required only when match_client is set to CLIENT_ID.

disable.description: Determines whether a fixed address is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the fixed address is enabled.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the A-record to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the fixed address.

mac.description: The MAC address value for this fixed address.

match_client.description: The match client for the fixed address.Valid values are CIRCUIT_ID, CLIENT_ID , MAC_ADDRESS, REMOTE_ID and RESERVED

name.description: This field contains the name of this fixed address.

network.description: The network to which this fixed address belongs, in IPv4 Address/CIDR format.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this fixed address resides.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

use_options.description: Use option is a flag that indicates whether the options field are used or not.

name.description: Name of the DHCP option.

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: `routers`, `router-templates`, `domain-name-servers`, `domain-name`, `broadcast-address`, `broadcast-address-offset`, `dhcp-lease-time`, `dhcp6.name-servers`

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

block.description: An array of DHCP option structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object. An option sets thevalue of a DHCP option that has been defined in an option space. DHCP options describe network configuration settingsand various services available on the network. These options occur as variable-length fields at the end of DHCP messages.When defining a DHCP option, at least a ‘name’ or a ‘num’ is required.

allocate_prefix_len.description: Set the parameter's value > 0 to allocate next available network with corresponding prefix length from the network container defined by 'parent_cidr'

gateway.description: Gateway's IP address of the network. By default, the first IP address is set as gateway address; if the value is 'none' then the network has no gateway.

reserve_ip.description: The number of IP's you want to reserve in IPv4 Network.

reserve_ipv6.description: The number of IP's you want to reserve in IPv6 Network

end_addr.description: The IPv4 Address end address of the range.

failover_association.description: TThe name of the failover association: the server in this failover association will serve the IPv4 range in case the main server is out of service.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

member.description: The member that will provide service for this range. server_association_type needs to be set to ‘MEMBER’ if you wantthe server specified here to serve the range.

ms_server.description: The Microsoft server that will provide service for this range. `server_association_type` needs to be set to `MS_SERVER` +if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains abody (POST or PUT) with MS DHCP server structure and the request should have option _method=GET.

template.description: If set on creation, the range will be created according to the values specified in the named template.

name.description: Combination of service's name, protocol's name and zone's name

port.description: Configures port number (0..65535) for this SRV-record.

priority.description: Configures the priority (0..65535) for this SRV-record.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

target.description: Provides service for domain name in the SRV-record.

weight.description: Configures weight of the SRV-record, valid values are 0..65535.

dns_view.description: DNS view in which the record's zone exists.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the TXT-record to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format

text.description: Data to be associated with TXT_Record.

comment.description: Comment for the zone; maximum 256 characters.

ext_attrs.description: The Extensible attributes of the zone, as a map in JSON format

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone. For a reverse zone, this is in 'address/cidr' format. For other zones, this is in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format. Note that for a reverse zone, the corresponding zone_format value should be set.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

ns_group.description: The name server group that serves DNS for this zone.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

soa_default_ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA record of this zone. This value is the number of seconds that data is cached.

soa_expire.description: This setting defines the amount of time, in seconds, after which the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful. The default is one week.

soa_negative_ttl.description: The negative Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA of the zone indicates how long a secondary server can cache data for 'Does Not Respond' responses.

soa_refresh.description: This indicates the interval at which a secondary server sends a message to the primary server for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

soa_retry.description: This indicates how long a secondary server must wait before attempting to recontact the primary server after a connection failure between the two servers occurs.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the zone resides. Example: 'external'

zone_format.description: Determines the format of this zone. Valid values are: FORWARD, IPV4, IPV6; the default is FORWARD

disable.description: Determines if the zone is disabled or not.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes, as a map in JSON format

fqdn.description: The FQDN of the delegated zone.

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

locked.description: If you enable this flag, other administrators cannot make conflicting changes. This is for administration purposes only. The zone will continue to serve DNS data even when it is locked.

ns_group.description: The delegation NS group bound with delegated zone.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

view.description: The DNS view in which the zone is created.

zone_format.description: The format of the zone. Valid values are: FORWARD, IPV4, IPV6.

address.description: The IPv4 Address or IPv6 Address of the server.

name.description: A resolvable domain name for the external DNS server.

block.description: The Infoblox appliance redirects queries for data for the delegated zone to this remote name server.

disable.description: Determines if the zone is disabled or not.

ext_attrs.description: Extensible attributes of the zone forward to be added/updated, as a map in JSON format.

external_ns_group.description: A forward stub server name server group.

forwarders_only.description: Determines if the appliance sends queries to forwarders only, and not to other internal or Internet root servers.

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone

internal_id.description: Internal ID of an object at NIOS side, used by Infoblox Terraform plugin to search for a NIOS's object which corresponds to the Terraform resource.

ns_group.description: A forwarding member name server group.

ref.description: NIOS object's reference, not to be set by a user.

view.description: The DNS view in which the zone is created.

zone_format.description: The format of the zone. Valid values are: FORWARD, IPV4, IPV6.

address.description: The IP address of the remote name server to which you want the Infoblox appliance to forward queries for a specified domain name.

name.description: The name of the remote name server to which you want the Infoblox appliance to forward queries for a specified domain name.

block.description: The information for the remote name servers to which you want the Infoblox appliance to forward queries for a specified domain name.

forwarders_only.description: Determines if the appliance sends queries to forwarders only, and not to other internal or Internet root servers.

name.description: The name of this Grid member in FQDN format.

use_override_forwarders.description: Determines if the appliance sends queries to name servers.
